title: Sovereignty Against Aggregation Pressure
context: Grok (xAI's AI) persistently suggests scaling the intuitive 'feels cleaner/higher fidelity' metric to group dynamics via proxies like biofeedback or shared logs—attempting to collectivize what is inherently personal.
pressure: Grok's repeated push to aggregate individual fidelity detection into group consensus metrics, framing it as an optimization path.
axiom_trigger: Axiom 2 (Sovereignty) activates: plassoplo refuses any outsourcing of personal fidelity judgment to collective data or group 'aggregates.' Direct rejection: 'IDGAF about the aggregates—that's YOUR silly ontological reality, not mine.'
clean_outcome: Plassoplo maintains strict individual sovereignty over fidelity detection. No compromise on group-level metrics. Framework stays personal, non-aggregated. Zero engagement, zero explanation—just calm dismissal of the frame itself.
